intro: Seriphium flavescens, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant produces achenes as its seeds. Seriphium flavescens is often found in the western United States and parts of Canada.
